item.content:encoded:
Flash Professional 8 Video Integration is now available over at Lynda.com. The price is $99, which considering how many hours I put into it, is a pretty good deal. Buying the CD-ROM gives you all of the exercise files unlike the basic Lynda.com online subscription. If you want to know about Flash video, this is thing to get! And I just want to give a special thanks to Stefan Richter for helping with the Flash Media Server section.

For those of you who helped out with this project, I won’t be able to send you your free copies until I get them in. Hopefully it will be very soon.

item.content:encoded:
My blog spam is getting out of control as of late. Don’t get me wrong, I love Indian porn, black cream pies (?), and I already have a good source for cheap Xanax. Does anyoe know of a good comment blog system to filter this crap out?

Ideally it would be one of the ones that makes the user type in a word from one of those warped images.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Lee

item.content:encoded:

This is more of a beginner tutorial but it will still be useful to more advanced users, especially if you haven’t done this before in Flash 8. Check it out at http://www.gotoandlearn.com.

item.title: BitmapData Random Flower
item.dc:creator: Lee Brimelow
item.content:encoded:
Just more fun with the BitmapData and ColorTransform classes. Click on the image below to see the animation or click here. Thanks to Janice Joplin for the 60's soundtrack as this has a very psychadelic feel. And only 9.5k!

PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. #include "lmc_tween.as"
  2.  
  3. import flash.filters.BlurFilter;
  4. import flash.display.BitmapData;
  5. import flash.geom.ColorTransform;
  6.  
  7. var bmd:BitmapData = new BitmapData(Stage.width,Stage.height,true,0xFFFFFF);
  8. this.createEmptyMovieClip("bmdc",1);
  9. bmdc.attachBitmap(bmd,0);
  10.  
  11. var bf:BlurFilter = new BlurFilter(5,5,1);
  12. bmdc.filters = [bf];
  13.  
  14. var rr:Number = Math.random();
  15. var gr:Number = Math.random();
  16. var br:Number = Math.random();
  17.  
  18. var ct:ColorTransform = new ColorTransform(rr,gr,br,.9,rr,gr,br,.9);
  19.  
  20. this.createEmptyMovieClip("holder",2);
  21. holder.attachMovie("flower","flower",0);
  22. holder.flower._x = Stage.width/2;
  23. holder.flower._y = Stage.height/2;
  24.  
  25. function moveIt() {
  26.         rr = Math.random()+.5;
  27.         gr = Math.random()+.5;
  28.         br = Math.random()+.5;
  29.         ct = new ColorTransform(rr,gr,br,.99,rr,gr,br,.99);
  30.         holder.flower.rotateTo(holder.flower._rotation+Math.random()*100,.3,"easeOutQuad",0,moveIt);
  31.         holder.flower.scaleTo(Math.random()*230,.3,"easeOutQuad");
  32. }
  33.  
  34. this.onEnterFrame = function() {
  35.         bmd.draw(holder);
  36.         bmd.colorTransform(bmd.rectangle,ct);
  37. }
  38.  
  39. moveIt();
  40.  
  41. var s:Sound = new Sound();
  42. s.loadSound("joo.mp3",true);
  43. s.onSoundComplete = function() {
  44.         s.start();
  45. }

Lee

item.title: BitmapData Glow Trails
item.dc:creator: Lee Brimelow
item.content:encoded:
Many people have created trails using BitmapData so today I actually learned how to do it. This is really fun stuff!

PLAIN TEXT
Actionscript:
  1. import mx.transitions.easing.*;
  2. import mx.transitions.Tween;
  3. import flash.display.BitmapData;
  4. import flash.filters.*;
  5. import flash.geom.ColorTransform;
  6.  
  7. var bmd:BitmapData = new BitmapData(600,400,true,0x00000000);
  8. this.createEmptyMovieClip("bmdc",1);
  9.  
  10. this.createEmptyMovieClip("ballc",2);
  11. ballc.attachMovie("ball","ball",0);
  12.  
  13. var bf:BlurFilter = new BlurFilter(5,5,1);
  14. var gf:GlowFilter = new GlowFilter(0x0099CC,30,35,35,1,1,false,false);
  15. bmdc.filters = [bf,gf];
  16. var ct:ColorTransform = new ColorTransform(.5,.9,.2,.99,1,1,.7,.99);
  17.  
  18. bmdc.attachBitmap(bmd,0);
  19.  
  20. function moveIt(who) {
  21.         var tw:Tween = new Tween(who,"_x",Normal.easeOut,who._x,Math.random()*Stage.width,2,true);
  22.         var tw2:Tween = new Tween(who,"_y",Normal.easeOut,who._y,Math.random()*Stage.height,2,true);
  23.         var tw3:Tween = new Tween(who,"_rotation",Normal.easeOut,who._rotation,Math.random()*720,2,true);
  24.         tw.onMotionStopped = function() {
  25.                 moveIt(who);
  26.         }
  27. }
  28.  
  29. this.onEnterFrame = function() {
  30.         bmd.draw(ballc);
  31.         bmd.colorTransform(bmd.rectangle,ct);   
  32. }
  33.  
  34. moveIt(ballc.ball);
  35.  

Lee

item.title: Full Browser Flash Tutorial
item.dc:creator: Lee Brimelow
item.description: I have just uploaded a new tutorial called Full Browser Flash which shows you how to use the BitmapData class to fill the browser window with a seamless background pattern. Then I show you how to setup a full browser movie so that your assets don't scale and remain centered on the stage. Check it [...]
item.content:encoded:
I have just uploaded a new tutorial called Full Browser Flash which shows you how to use the BitmapData class to fill the browser window with a seamless background pattern. Then I show you how to setup a full browser movie so that your assets don't scale and remain centered on the stage. Check it out at http://www.gotoandlearn.com.

Lee
